BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: YOUNG MENS CHRISTIAN ASSOCIATION OF SCOTTSBLUFF

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO HELP PEOPLE DEVELOP A HEALTHY SPIRIT, MIND, AND BODY THROUGH THE USE OF VOLUNTEERS AND PROFESSIONAL STAFF. THE YMCA USES CHRISTIAN PRINCIPLES TO DEVELOP AFFORDABLE PROGRAMS THAT STRENGTHEN AND ENRICH INDIVIDUAL AND FAMILY LIVES, AND BRING A DEEPER RELATIONSHIP WITH GOD.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO HELP PEOPLE DEVELOP A HEALTHY SPIRIT, MIND, AND BODY THROUGH THE USE OF VOLUNTEERS AND PROFESSIONAL STAFF.
IRS990.Desc: HEALTH AND WELL BEING PROGRAMS: THE YMCA PROVIDES INSTRUCTORS, EQUIPMENT, AND FACILITIES SO MEMBERS AND OTHERS CAN IMPROVE THEIR OWN HEALTH AND WELL BEING, EITHER ON THEIR OWN OR IN A GROUP SETTING, AND DEVELOP A HEALTHY SPIRIT, MIND, AND BODY. PROGRAMS ARE DESIGNED TO BE APPROPRIATE FOR SENIORS, YOUTH AND THOSE WITH SPECIAL NEEDS. AQUATICS: THE YMCA OPERATES A VARIETY OF POOLS FOR ITS MEMBERS AND GUESTS. CLASSES RANGE FROM INTRODUCING INFANTS TO WATER WITH THEIR PARENTS. TO HELPING SENIORS AND OTHERS WITH SPECIAL NEEDS IMPROVE MOVEMENT IN THE THERAPY POOL WHEN CLASSES ARE NOT IN SESSION. THE POOL IS OPEN TO LAP SWIMMERS AND TO FAMILIES. YOUTH AND ADULT SWIM LESSONS AND WATER SAFETY PROGRAMS ARE OFFERED THROUGHOUT THE YEAR. TRAILS WEST YMCA CAMP: THE YMCA OPERATES A CAMP ON THE BANKS OF THE NORTH PLATTE RIVER. SUMMER DAY CAMP AVERAGES 70 CAMPERS A DAY AND IS FOR YOUTH AGES 5-12. EACH DAY BEGINS WITH A CHAPEL SERVICE AND IS FILLED WITH ACTIVITIES THAT PROMOTE THE YMCA'S FOUR CORE VALUES: CARING, HONESTY, RESPECT, AND RESPONSIBILITY. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE SWIMMING, HIKING, CLIMBING WALL ROPES CHALLENGE COURSE, FIELD TRIP AND MORE. THE CAMP FACILITIES ARE ALSO AVAILABLE TO OTHER GROUPS SO THEY CAN CONDUCT THEIR OWN ACTIVITIES. THE YMCA OF SCOTTSBLUFF OFFERS MANY OTHER PROGRAMS FOR YOUTH AND ADULTS, ALL DESIGNED TO DEVELOP A HEALTHY SPIRIT, MIND, AND BODY. THE YMCA PRESCHOOL TEACHES CHRISTIAN VALUES AND SOCIAL SKILLS AS KIDS ARE PREPARED FOR KINDERGARTEN. OTHER PROGRAMS INCLUDE TEAM AND INDIVIDUAL SPORTS WHICH ARE TAUGHT TO KIDS IN A WIDE VARIETY OF PROGRAMS. SPORTSMANSHIP, TEAMWORK AND OTHER SKILLS ARE LEARNED IN THIS NON-THREATENING ENVIRONMENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule D, Part V, Line 4 Intended uses of endowment funds
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS ADOPTED A SPENDING POLICY ALLOWING USES OF ENDOWMENT RESOURCES FOR THE PURCHASE OF REPLACEMENT OF CAPITAL ASSETS, MAJOR REPAIRS, AND TEMPORARY OPERATING SUPPORT WHICH IS REQUIRED TO BE REPAID WITHIN ONE YEAR. ADDITIONALLY, OTHER USES WILL BE GRANTED WITH A TWO-THIRDS MAJORITY VOTE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. ORGANIZATIONAL HAS STIPULATED ENDOWMENT FUND ASSETS WILL NOT BE DEPLETED BELOW THE SPECIFIED AMOUNT OF $1,500,000

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 6 Classes of members or stockholders
Form 990, Part VI, Line 7a Members or stockholders electing members of governing body
Form 990, Part VI, Line 8b Documentation of meetings held by committees of governing body
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Minutes are prepared for board of directors meetings. Meetings of committees are kept if actionable matters are acted upon.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b Review of form 990 by governing body
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION REVIEWS THE 990 RETURN AND APPROVES PRIOR TO SIGNING AND FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c Conflict of interest policy
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS ARE GIVEN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST QUESTIONNAIRE TO COMPLETE WHICH ASKS ABOUT VARIOUS POSSIBLE CONFLICTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a Process to establish compensation of top management official
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH YEAR, THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE CONDUCTS REVIEW OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S PERFORMANCE. COMPENSATION FOR THE FOLLOWING YEAR IS BASED ON THE RESULTS OF THIS REVIEW.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19 Required documents available to the public
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE YMCA OF SCOTTSBLUFF MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENT AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VIII, Line 2f Other Program Service Revenue

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART III, LINE 1 ORGANIZATION MISSION
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: To help people develop a healthy spirit, mind, and body through the use of volunteers and professional staff. The YMCA uses christian principles to develop affordable programs that strengthen and enrich individual and family lives, and bring a deeper relationship with God.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part III, Line 4A Program Service Accomplishments
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Health and well being programs: The YMCA provides instructors, equipment, and facilities so members and other can improve their own health and well being, either on their own or in a group setting, and develop a healthy spirit, mind and body. Programs are design to be appropriate for seniors, youth, and those with special needs. Aquatics: The YMCA operates a variety of pools for its members and guests. Classes range from introducing infants to water with their parents, to helping seniors and others with special needs improve movement in the therapy pool. When classes are not in session, the pool is open to lap swimmer and the families. Youth and adult swim lessons and water safety programs are offered throughout the year. Trails West YMCA Camp: The YMCA operates a camp on the banks of the North Platte River. Summer day camp averages 70 campers a day and is for youth ages 5-12. Each day begins with a chapel service and is filled with activities that promote the YMCA's four core values: caring, honesty, respect, and responsibility. Activities include swimming, hiking, climbing wall ropes challenge course, field trips, and more. The camp facilities are also available to other groups so they can conduct their own activities.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Pat III, Line 4A Program service accomplishments
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The YMCA of Scottsbluff offers many other programs for youth and adults, all designed to develop a healthy spirit, mind, and body. the YMCA preschool teaches a Christian values and social skills as kids are prepared for kindergarten. Other programs include team and individual sports which are taught to kids in a wide variety of programs. Sportsmanship, teamwork and other skills are learned in this non-threatening environment.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11B Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization reviews the 990 return and approves prior to signing and filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12C Explanation of monitoring and enforcement of conclicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Board members are given a conflict of interest questionnaire to complete which asks about various possible conflicts.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19 Other organization documents publicly available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The YMCA of Scottsbluff makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statement available to the public upon request.
